scenario: Prologis (PLD) stock continued its upward momentum after a solid quarterly earnings report, with a 3% increase in share price on Thursday, outperforming the 0.5% rise of the S&P 500. The company beat consensus analyst estimates on both top and bottom lines, with core funds from operations (FFO) rising 10% year over year. This performance led to several analyst updates, including a price target raise to $115 per share by Evercore ISI's Steve Sakwa, who maintained a neutral recommendation. JPMorgan Chase's Michael Muller reiterated an overweight (buy) recommendation and $131 price target on the stock. Prologis is expected to have a prosperous 2025, with brisk leasing activity and increasing involvement in the data center segment, driven by growing demand for data storage due to artificial intelligence.
